subject: Re: [junit] Thanks
msgSnippet: I missed last post. As far as I know, JBuilder is using licensed Sun JDK.  So the problem here might be just that it is a different version. A simple and
messageBody:
I missed last post.

As far as I know, JBuilder is using licensed Sun JDK. So the problem
here might be just that it is a different version.

A simple and straightforward solution is to configure JBuilder to use
whichever JDK you are using with the ant and standard JDK. You can do
that through Tools --> Configure JDKs.

That is what I am doing because of some known locale issue with JDK
1.3.0 bundled with JBuilder.


--
Disclaimer: I join all the news groups out of my own interest. All
opinions expressed here are my own and not necessarily those of my
employer.


Pankaj Solanki wrote:

> Thanks Sarah,I will try that.Regards, Pankaj
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Sarah Wustner
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Sent: Wednesday, September 05, 2001 6:58 PM
> Subject: RE: [junit] JUnit3.7 Error message
> My group ran into something similar recently -- some people
> had built their code with JBuilder, and others had built
> with ant and the standard JDK. We got odd errors when we
> tried to run code together that had been compiled
> differently. Apparently, JBuilder uses its own internal JDK
> which is not 100% the same as the standard. It would not
> surprise me if VisualCafe did something similar.Your best
> bet is probably to standardize on one or the other - either
> compile and run everything from inside of Visual Cafe, or
> use it only as your editor and instead use ant (or make, or
> whatever) to build and run.
> -----Original Message-----
> From: David Roussel [mailto:dir@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, September 05, 2001 6:28 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: RE: [junit] JUnit3.7 Error message
>
>
> Sorry Pank I don't know the solution to you
> problem. However I used to use VisualCafe 4 and
> now I have moved to Ant, Jikes and a text editor I
> suffer less stress.
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Pankaj Solanki [mailto:psolanki@...]
> Sent: 05 September 2001 14:18
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] JUnit3.7 Error message
>
> Hi all, Will any of you plz assess, why my
> SimpleTest.java file is failing : The problem I am
> facing is: When I compile a junit test file thru'
> VisualCafe4.0, it gets compiled without any
> error.Later while invoking the TestRunner utility
> from console (any approach - textui, awtui or
> swingui),I am getting following error
> message: java.lang.IncompatibleClassChangeError:
> junit.framework.Assert: method
> assert(Ljava/lang/String;Z)V did not used to be
> static at
> junit.samples.SimpleTest.testAdd(SimpleTest.java:32)But
> surprisingly if I compile the same file from
> console and run the TestRunner utility then test
> passes without any error and it show a green bar.
> Perfect run. My VisualCafe4.0 setting is fine
> (junit.jar and the directory which contain this
> jar file is included in the classpath of sc.ini
> file). Thanks, Pankaj
>
